title: Amazing Latte and Speed!
review: Wow, it took the guy less than a min to make this amazing latte. It was amazing and at the perfect temperature. The inside is nice and bright.  Great customer service and attention to detail. They have a seasonal latte.

title: Golden Gate Bridge Tour
review: We did a SF Red Bus Tour which ends up going across the Golden Gate bridge several times and stops on the far side for you to get and enjoy the view back across the bay towards SF
businessAddress: Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco, CA

title: Twin Peaks Trail
review: A great destination for tourists and locals. You and drive to the top or plan ahead and use one of the trails that start at the bottom. Once you're at the top, you get a stunning 360¬∞ view of San Francisco. It does get windy, so bring a jacket!
businessAddress: 501 Twin Peaks Blvd, San Francisco, CA

title: Denver Botanic Gardens
review: Incredible botanical gardens! One of the best I‚Äôve ever been to. This is an extensive installation that is impressive and breathtaking. Truly one of my favorite places in Denver, these gardens are well-curated, -arranged, and -kept. Visiting here was a complete joy and I truly hope to come again ‚Äî it is very large and you can‚Äôt take it all in in a single two-hour stroll.

title: Downtown Aquarium
review: Very cool looking aquarium from the outside, we bought the Denver city pass and this saved us a lot on the admission cost, once inside all the attractions are in the second floor, bathrooms are in the first floor, so better go before going up!.  They have cool tanks, but not much information listed anywhere to know what they are in those tanks, you are given a map at the entrance (1 per household) and was quickly damaged by falling water. Useless ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è... You can go through the whole place in a short time. We chose to check out the 4D theater and all I have to say is that it's not worth it at all, they gave us 3d glasses that are all dirty or damaged, the screen is full and not bright at all, supposedly they have wind sound but all I heard was an old fan making noise to make wind. Pretty lame. Save your $ on that.

title: Little Beast Street Food
review: Back for more! 100% worth the drive across town. Shared a bulgogi sandwich with my husband so we could get wings (which are perfectly crispy yet moist) and beer. Next time we don't share! The sandwich is the best I've ever had. Perfect balance of savory meat and kimchi wrapped up in a unique flat bread that doesn't get soggy. üòã  Friendly staff and vibe. Can't get back soon enough with friends in tow!

title: Momofuku Noodle Bar
review: Worth the wait as every dish done to perfection! Love the interior with a clean modern design. Service was great and food was prepped relatively fast despite and number of guests.

title: Prince St. Pizza
review: Instant classic. Best late night food. Get the pepperoni square slices and ask for extra crispy. You will not be disappointed. Although their sister restaurant Village Square Pizza is still better in my book, they are hard to beat as the late night spot. Don't get scared away by the lines, it moves quick!
businessAddress: 27 Prince St A, New York, NY

title: Statue Of Liberty
review: It was breathtaking. It's even more interesting and magnificent when you get to know how it was built. You learn a lot of things as you climb the stairs in the pedestal. If you visit new York this place should be number one on your list.

title: The Counter at Old Ballard Catering Co.
review: All the takeout from The Counter has been excellent from tacos, to gyros, to chicken tenders. They offer drinks to go at a reasonable price too and the online ordering is painless. The chicken tenders here might honestly be some the best I've ever had. It wasn't what I was expecting at all when I bit into it because it was just SO good. Lucky to have this gem in the neighborhood.
business: The Counter at Old Ballard Catering Co.

title: UnCruise Adventures
review: Uncruise cancelled our cruise in April 2020 because of the pandemic and refused to refund our money.  They gave us a voucher to go on a cruise later, but $15k is a lot of money to have to eat, and who knows if we will be healthy enough to go on a cruise by the time it's ok to travel again.  We are older. We aren't happy with this cruise line.  If we are able to go on a cruise sometime with this line to use our voucher, it will be the one and only time we do so. Shame on you Uncruise.  The airlines were very accommodating in refunding all of our money.

title: Discovery Park
review: A lot of construction going on right now - view point was not accessible (unsafe)

title: Portland Japanese Garden
review: Seeing these gardens in peak fall foliage was a magical experience. Highly recommend. And thank you to the friendly staff. You are much appreciated!

title: Ground Kontrol Classic Arcade and Bar
review: What a wonderful place! Affordable and friendliness are plentiful at Ground Kontrol. I highly recommend this fabulous place for anyone looking for some games and beverages. I especially enjoyed the pinball selection and the very friendly staff working diligently to maintain them. I didn‚Äôt try any food but I can speak the truth by saying that this place is a MUST SEE!!!!!
business: Ground Kontrol Classic Arcade and Bar

title: Oregon Jewish Museum and Center for Holocaust Education
review: The space is small but well designed. Great cafe and bookstore. Docents are available during the day and some weekends. In association with the Holocaust memorial in Washington Park.
business: Oregon Jewish Museum and Center for Holocaust Education

title: Tokyo Skytree
review: Beautiful observatory tower. Tickets can be purchased online but you can also purchase from an automated machine. Amazing view & a must visit observatory tower.
businessAddress: 1 Chome-1-2 Oshiage, Sumida City, Tokyo, Japan

title: teamLab Borderless
review: Incredible experience, well worth the price. Recommend booking tickets in advance and trying to go on a weekday or morning if possible for fewer crowds. Allow at least a couple of hours and make sure to check all the curtains inside so you don‚Äôt miss anything. There are lots of fun interactive exhibits and an art area where you can design your own sea creature then see it ‚Äúswimming‚Äù in a digital aquarium which is really fun. Make sure you wear comfortable clothes if you want to participate in the physical exhibits which are loads of fun.
businessAddress: Japan, Tokyo, Koto City, Aomi, 1 Chome‚àí3‚àí8

title: Soul Food House
review: Dry and moist in the wrong places. Moist in the crust, dry in the meat. That's what to expect from the chicken and waffles. Little to no soul in this place. Except for the staff they're very nice.
businessAddress: Japan, „Äí106-0045 Tokyo, Minato City, Azabujuban, 2 Chome‚àí8‚àí10 Ôº∞ÔΩÅÔΩîÔΩâÔΩèÔºñF

title: Fairmont Banff Springs
review: Unexpectedly upgraded to Gold. The breakfast was wonderful. The room was small but enough and updated. The shower had multiple jets, such luxury. The opportunities to eat on site are ample and delicious. Schnitzel and fondue anyone? The pool is lovely indoor and out. Felt safe and sanitized. Best part was the staff, Tania and the rest of the team were such great hosts, helpful and kind. I‚Äôd give them 6 stars if I could.
businessAddress: 405 Spray Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1J4, Canada

title: Banff National Park
review: Greatest place to visit in Canada.  Plenty of activities to do on your visit.  Blue torquoise lakes with snow capped mountain, meadow and alpine ranges. Sightseeing, biking, hiking, stroll the main street, visit the hot springs, hoodoos, take the Gondola to Sulphur Mountain, visit Bow Falls, Fenland Park, Vermillion Lake. Great food and friendly people. Views, views and did I say more amazing views.  So much activities to do there‚Äôs just not enough time. Lake Louise, Kananskis, Jasper and Canmore area are all a short drive away if you‚Äôve got more than a weekend to spare.  Super beautiful. You‚Äôll be amazed and will definitely return.

title: Whyte Museum of the Canadian Rockies
review: It's a small museum, okay place. $10 entrance fees. You can skip it if not very fond of museum. If have nothing else to do, can visit it once.
business: Whyte Museum of the Canadian Rockies

title: Eiffel Tower
review: I though visiting in March or springtime would be beautiful; however, that year winter lasted a little longer than usual. There wasn't very much greenery and the vegetation was more brown and dried. There were very long lines with hours wait time. I opted to taken ground photos only as I did not want to waste valuable sightseeing time standing idly in lines. Seeing the Tower was still a once in a lifetime event. You could feel the history when gazing upon the structure.
businessAddress: Champ de Mars, 5 Av. Anatole France, Paris, France

title: Yann Couvreur P√¢tisserie
review: It is the second time visit the place. We shared 3 personal patisseries between the two of us: lemon tart, hazelnut cake and blueberries tart. All three were excellent.

title: City of Science and Industry
review: It's a very pleasant area with hard paving, the canal and a park. The only issue is that the covered main area and route through is cobblestone with no smooth path and my baby daughter in the buggy didn't appreciate it...

title: Burj Al Arab
review: Had dinner at the Sal restaurant at the Burj Al Arab. The service was upto the mark. The place is definitely iconic by all means. The place serves Spanish and Portuguese food. The starters were amazing but wasn't much impressed by the main course. We had the lamb chops and the sea food platter for the mains, and the prawns in tomato sauce and wild crabs in starters. The highlight was the tour of the hotel and it does have its charm.

title: Museum Of Illusions, Dubai
review: Good place to visit if you never been to similar place. Good place to take more pics if you know the best angles to click. Staffs around is very helpful in guiding. Kids had good fun.

title: Al Montazah Parks
review: Time well spent with kid. They dont have much of rides for adults but for kids, it is totally worth it. The place is too good. Parents can have leisure time and kids can enjoy.

title: Aoraki / Mount Cook
review: So beautiful!!! Loved spending our time here with my husband for our 5th wedding anniversary.

title: Lake Tekapo
review: Lake Tekapo is an attractive place with open spaces to enjoy adventure and quite time. the lake is beautiful and there are good viewing spots. Lake Tekapo has good restaurants with quality food and wine, and the township is clean and tidy. We walked to the Tekapo Springs for the Night time group swim and Astronomy event - the Stars were very bright - safe and enjoyable. We enjoyed a day out to Mount John observatory - the view are spectacular and we enjoyed a hot cuppa tea and scone from the shop there. Lake Tekapo has  an historic Church which attracts tourists we highly recommend it for a visit 10/10

title: Coronet Peak
review: Got lucky today with a perfect blue sky and 7cm of fresh snow leading to quite the  wide-open powder slopes. Very little crowds too. The only disappointing thing though was having next to nothing in the terms of a terrain park. Only a few low rails and boxes with a magic carpet.
businessAddress: Coronet Peak Ski Area, Queenstown, New Zealand
